person.persName: George Baird Hodge (Kentucky attorney, soldier CSA, Rep to congress (prov gov & CSA))

body.p: Kentucky soldier, attorney, and politician.Fleming County, Kentucky, native. Married to Keturah Moss Tibbatts Hodge. Father of S. Catherine Taylor Hodge, Anna Taylor Hodge, Jane “Nan” Hodge, Mary Hodge, William Baird Hodge, Georgena Baird Hodge, and John T. Hodge. Educated at Maysville Seminary. Appointed to and graduated from the United States Naval Academy in 1845. Served as a midshipman and acting lieutenant in the Mexican War. Resigned from the U.S. Navy in 1851. Admitted to the bar and practiced law in Newport, Kentucky.Attorney in Mason County in 1850. Member of the Whig Party and Southern Democratic Party. Ran unsuccessfully for the United States House of Representatives as a Whig Party member in 1852. Elected to the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1859. Elector for John C. Breckinridge in 1860. Attorney in Campbell County in 1860. Served in John C. Breckinridge’s First Kentucky Bridge, in Joseph Wheeler’s and Nathan Bedford Forrest’s Cavalry, and as commander of the Southwest Mississippi and East Louisiana during the Civil War. He enlisted as a private and achieved the rank of brigadier general. Member of the Council of Ten in the Provisional Government of Kentucky. Member of the Provisional Congress of the Confederate States from 1861 to 1862. Member of the Committee on Foreign Relations for the Provisional Government of Kentucky. Member of the First and Second Confederate Congress in the House of Representatives for the Eighth Congressional District from 1862 to 1864.
